what is the mean of tar-xvvf??
I donno what it mean
tar is a program
they are the same
a tar file is simply a way of keeping many files in one file
xvf are flags
flags are given with -
so     tar   -z -x -v -f    give the tar program four flags      these flags can be put together, like this    tar -zxvf
you usually also give a file to the tar program, like this    tar -zxvf somefile.tar.gz     which will make tar extract somefile.tar.gz
for the details of what the different flags do (they are different for each program)   do man tar
after you have issued that command, tar will extract the files
a gzipped file is a file zipped with gzip
just like a .zip file on windows
if you don't want to use the command line, you can just doubleclick on a gzip file and Ubuntu will open up an extracter for you
